com.logitopia.jmortar.core.persistence.dao.component

Interface WritableDataAccessComponent<T>

  • Type Parameters:
    T - The business model element to be stored or loaded with data from the database.
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractWritableDataAccessComponent, WritableDynamoDBDataAccessComponentImpl, WritableHibernateDataAccessComponentImpl

    public interface WritableDataAccessComponent<T>
    The WritableDataAccessComponent interface is a ...TODO

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void delete(T newModel)
      The delete command will attempt to find the referenced business model object and delete it from the database.
      void save(T newModel)
      The save method will take a generic instance of a business model and save a new instance of this object to the database.
      void update(T newModel)
      The update method will take an instance of a business model and update any differing records for an existing entry in the database.

    • Method Detail

      • save

        void save(T newModel)
   throws DataAccessWriteLockingException,
          DataAccessWriteDuplicateEntryException
        The save method will take a generic instance of a business model and save a new instance of this object to the database. The save operation is a hard-write meaning that it will override an existing entry.
        Parameters:
        newModel - The business model to be saved.
        Throws:
        DataAccessWriteLockingException - When the write fails for optimistic locking.
        DataAccessWriteDuplicateEntryException - When the write fails because the entry already exists.

      • update

        void update(T newModel)
     throws DataAccessWriteLockingException
        The update method will take an instance of a business model and update any differing records for an existing entry in the database. This mirrors the UPDATE sql command.
        Parameters:
        newModel - The business model to be updated.
        Throws:
        DataAccessWriteLockingException - When the write fails for optimistic locking.

      • delete

        void delete(T newModel)
     throws DataAccessWriteLockingException
        The delete command will attempt to find the referenced business model object and delete it from the database.
        Parameters:
        newModel - The business model to be deleted.
        Throws:
        DataAccessWriteLockingException - When the write fails for optimistic locking.
